translation.en: Did I not warn you what would come of dealing with Dwarves?
They've woken the dragon, they've brought the apocalypse upon our heads.
Faster now, I'm trying to evacuate myself here.
Never mind the books! Get the rest of it.
But Sire, should we not try to save the town?
The town is lost, save the gold!
-We have no time. We must leave. -Get him up.
-I'm fine, I can walk. -Fast as you can.
We're not leaving, not without our father.
If you stay here, your sisters will die. Is that what your father would want?
-Give me your hand. -Come on, gotta go!
If only we could take more of these poor people with us.
-But they're hardly… -…worth it. I quite agree.
He did, he hit its mark, I saw.
His arrows cannot pierce its hide.
What are you doing? Come back!
Bain! What are you doing? Why didn't you leave?
-No, nothing can stop it now. -This might.
You get out of here now.
Who are you that would stand against me?
What will you do now, bowman?
You cannot save him from the fire.
wretch, how now shall you challenge me?
By my beard, I think he's right!
The Ravens of Erebor are returning to the Mountain.
Before long, every soul in Middle-earth will know the dragon is dead.
-Will somebody help me! -Hey, let me go.
They are your people, you must go.
I know how I feel, I'm not afraid.
-You make me feel alive. -No, I can't.
I don't know what that means.
Take your leave of the Dwarf.
-These are dry. You'll need them. -Thank you.
Oi, give me one of them!
-I'll catch my death in this cold. -Find your own!
You're not in charge now, Alfrid Lickspittle.
In the absence of the Master,
the powers cedes to his deputy, which in this instance, is my good self.
You're a sneak thief, more like. I'll be dead before
I answer to the likes of you.
I wouldn't go turning on your own, Alfrid. Not now.
It was Bard. He killed the dragon. I saw it with me own eyes.
He brought the beast down. Struck him dead with a Black Arrow.
You've saved us all, bless you.
I have said it many times, this is a man of noble stock.
-A born leader. -Do not call me that.
I'm not the Master of this town.
with all our coin, I don't doubt.
You helped him empty the treasury.
No, I tried to stop him.
Will nobody think of the children?
Have you not had your fill of death?
We must look to our own, to the sick and the helpless.
Those who can stand, tend to the wounded,
and those with strength left, follow me.
-We must salvage what we can. -And what then?
You need to leave. We all need to leave.
I've tried talking to him, but he won't listen.
Thorin. Thorin, he's been down there for days.
He doesn't sleep, he barely eats.
He's not been himself, not at all.
It's this place. I think a sickness lies upon it.
Behold the great treasure hoard of Thrór.
The Arkenstone is in these halls.
No-one rests until it is found!
I am almost tempted to let you take it,
if only to see Oakenshield suffer.
we have a long march ahead.
We can take refuge inside the Mountain.
It might smell a bit of dragon. The women could clean it up.
It will be safe and warm and dry, and full of stores,
What gold is in that mountain, is cursed.
We'll take only what was promised,
only what we need to rebuild our lives.
News of the death of Smaug will have spread through the lands.
Others will now look to the Mountain
It's what I fear may come.
The King's son and a She-elf…
with an army of Elves at their back.
The Mountain will be their tomb!
The Orc I pursued out of Lake-town, I know who he is.
Bolg, the spawn of Azog the Defiler.
A Wargpack was waiting for him on the outskirts of Esgorath.
These Orcs weren't like the others,
they bore a mark I had not seen for a long time.
An Orc stronghold in the far north of the Misty Mountains.
I bring word from your father.
You are to return to him immediately.
if there is no place for Tauriel, there is no place for me.
but he does not command my heart.
I ride north. Will you come with me?
Spells will not save you, old man.
Three Rings for the Elven-kings under the sky…
Seven for the Dwarf-lords in their halls of stone…
Nine for mortal men doomed to die.
Are you in need of assistance, My Lady?
He is. The darkness has returned.
He cannot remain here, it is straining his life.
So shall the Kingdom of Angmar rise.
The time of the Elves is over.
The Age of the Orc has come.
He will flee into the East.
They must set a watch on the walls of Mordor.
No. Look after the Lady Galadriel.
She has spent much of her powers, her strength is failing.
My Lord Saruman, he must be hunted down
and destroyed, once and for all.
Sauron can never again hold dominion over Middle-earth.
-Gandalf, where are you going? -To warn Erebor.
They have no idea what is coming.
I saw them with my own eyes.
Rank upon rank of Moria Orcs.
You must summon our friends, bird and beast.
The battle for the Mountain is about to begin.
It is here in these halls,
Thorin, we all would see the stone returned.
And yet it's still not found!
Do you doubt the loyalty of anyone here?
The Arkenstone is the birthright of our people.
It is a fierce and jealous love, Bilbo.
It's the summit of this great wealth,
bestowing power upon him who bears it.
I fear it would make him worse.
I picked it up in Beorn's garden.
You've carried it all this way?
I'm going to plant it in my garden. In Bag End.
That's a poor prize to take back to the Shire.
and every time I look at it, I'll remember.
Remember everything that happened, the good, the bad,
and how lucky I am that I made it home.
Thorin, the survivors from Lake-town, they're streaming into Dale.
Look, Sire! The braziers are lit.
the company of Thorin Oakenshield survived.
You mean a bunch of Dwarves have all that gold?
There's gold in that Mountain for all.
Alfrid, you take the night watch.
I want this Fortress made safe by sun-up.
I will not see it taken again.
The people of Lake-town have nothing.
They came to us in need. They have lost everything.
Do not tell me what they have lost.
I know well enough their hardship.
Those who've lived through dragon fire should rejoice!
They have much to be grateful for.
Bring more stone to the gate!
These children are starving. We need food.
-Bard, we don't have enough. -Do what you can, Percy.
It will be all right, don't worry.
The children and the wounded and the women come first.
Morning, Alfrid, what news from the night watch?
All quiet, Sire. Not much to report.
Except an army of Elves, it would seem.
My Lord Thranduil, we did not look to see you here.
I do not know how to thank you.
I did not come on your behalf.
I came to reclaim something of mine.
There are gems in the Mountain that I too desire.
I know an Elf-lord who will pay a pretty price for these.
You would go to war over a handful of gems?
The heirlooms of my people are not lightly forsaken.
My people also have claim upon the riches in that mountain.
You would try to reason with the Dwarf.
We are glad to find you alive beyond hope.
Why do you come to gates of the King under the Mountain armed for war?
Why does the King under the Mountain fence himself in
like a robber in his hole?
Perhaps it is because I am expecting to be robbed.
we have not come to rob you, but to seek fair settlement.
Will you not speak with me?
On behalf of the people of Lake-town, I ask that you honor your pledge.
so that they might rebuild their lives.
I will not treat with any man while an armed host lies before my door.
That armed host will attack this mountain if we do not come to terms.
And your threats do not sway me.
Does it not tell you our cause is just?
and in return you brought upon them only ruin and death.
When did the men of Lake-town come to our aid but for the promise of rich reward.
What choice did we have but to barter our birthright for blankets and food.
To ransom our future in exchange for our freedom.
You call that a fair trade?
why should I honor such terms?
Because you gave us your word.
but just in case you haven't noticed, there is an army of Elves out there.
Not to mention several hundred angry fishermen.
Such a pity. But still you tried.
It is fruitless to reason with them.
This vest is made of silver steel.
Mithril, it was called by my forebears.
I look absurd. I'm not a warrior, I'm a Hobbit.
True friends are hard to come by.
I have been blind, but now I'm beginning to see.
One of them has taken it.
the quest is fulfilled, you've won the Mountain.
No, you made a promise to the people of Lake-town.
Is this treasure truly worth more than your honor?
Our honor, Thorin. I was also there, I gave my word.
That was nobly done. But the treasure in this mountain
does not belong to the people of Lake-town.
I will not part with a single coin.
This fortress was once its stronghold.
It is where they kept their great armories,
We wait for the cover of night.
It is a fell place, Tauriel.
In another age our people waged war on those lands.
My father does not speak of it.
We don't want no tramps, beggars,
We've got enough trouble without the likes of you.
Off you go. On your horse.
You must set aside your petty grievances with the Dwarves.
The cesspits of Dol Guldur have been emptied.
I can see you know nothing of wizards.
They are like winter thunder on a wild wind, rolling in from a distance
But sometimes a storm is just a storm.
Armies of Orcs are on the move.
These are fighters, they have been bred for war.
Our enemy has summoned his full strength.
We forced him when Thorin Oakenshield's company
set out to reclaim their homeland.
The Dwarves were never meant to reach Erebor,
Azog the Defiler was sent to kill them.
His master seeks control of the Mountain,
not just for the treasure within,
but for where it lies, it's strategic position.
This is the gateway to reclaiming the lands of Angmar in the North.
If that fell kingdom should rise again
These Orc armies you speak of, Mithrandir,
Our army will be in position by dawn.
The attack will be sudden and swift!
They have forgotten what lives beneath these lands.
They have forgotten the great Earth-eaters.
If we are going in, we should move now.
These bats are bred for one purpose.
We may be too late, hurry!
Since when has my counsel counted for so little?
What do you think I'm trying to do?
Trying to save your Dwarvish friends.
And I admire your loyalty to them.
But it does not dissuade me from my course.
You will forgive me if I finish it.
If anything moves on that mountain, kill it!
The Dwarves are out of time.
Is gold so important to you?
Would you buy it with the blood of Dwarves?
It will not come to that.
-This is a fight they cannot win. -That won't stop them.
You think the Dwarves will surrender? They won't.
They'll fight to the death to defend their own.
If I'm not mistaken, this is the halfling who stole
the keys to my dungeons from under the nose of my guards.
How is this yours to give?
I took it as my 14th share of the treasure.
I'm not doing it for you.
I know that Dwarves can be obstinate
with the worst manners you can possibly imagine, but they are also brave
I've grown very fond of them, and I would save them if I can.
But Thorin values this stone above all else.
In exchange for its return, I believe he will give you what you were owed.
There will be no need for war.
Get as far away as possible.
You picked me as the 14th man. I'm not about to leave the company now.
There is no company, not anymore.
And I hate to think what Thorin'll do
when he sees what you did.
Don't underestimate the evil of gold.
Gold over which a serpent had long brooded.
Dragon-sickness seeps into the hearts of all who get near this mountain.
and fill his belly with hot food.
Hey, keep an eye on him.
If he should try to leave, you tell me.
Wakey, wakey. Hobbit, up you get?
I will put the next between your eyes.
We have come to tell you
payment of your debt has been offered
How came you by the heirloom of our house?
That stone belongs to the King.
But first he must honor his word.
The Arkenstone is in this Mountain, it is a trick!
I took it as my 14th share.
I may be a burglar, but I like to think I'm an honest one.
I'm willing to let it stand against my claim.
you have no claim over me, you miserable rat!
I was going to give it to you.
-Many times I wanted to, but… -But what, thief?
The Dwarf I met in Bag End would never have gone back on his word,
would never have doubted the loyalty of his kin.
Do not speak to me of loyalty.
Cursed be the wizard that forced you on this company.
If you don't like my burglar,
You're not making a very splendid figure as King under the Mountain,
are you, Thorin, son of Thráin.
Never again will I have dealings with wizards…
The return of the Arkenstone for what was promised.
Who is that? He doesn't look very happy.
It is Dáin, Lord of the Iron Hills.
I've always found Thorin the more reasonable of the two.
if you wouldn't mind giving me a few moments of your time.
or I'll water the ground with their blood.
There is no need for war between Dwarves, Men and Elves.
A legion of Orcs march on the Mountain.
-Stand your army down. -I will not stand down before any Elf.
Not least this faithless woodland sprite.
He wishes nothing but ill upon my people.
If he chooses to stand between me and my kin,
I'll split his pretty head open!
See if he's still smirking then.
He's clearly mad, like his cousin.
We're on! Let's give these bastards a good hammering.
The hordes of Hell are upon us!
To battle, to battle, sons of Durin!
I'm going over the wall, who's coming with me?
The Elves, will they not fight?
Gandalf, is this a good place to stand?
They cannot fight on two fronts.
He's trying to cut us off.
All of you fall back to Dale!
To the city! Bilbo, this way!
My children, where are my children?
I saw them, they were down in the Old Market.
The market? Where are they now?
Bard, Orcs are storming over the causeway.
Get the bowmen to the eastern parapet. Hold them off for as long as you can.
The Orcs have taken Stone Street, the market is overrun.
The rest of you, follow me!
Listen, I need you to gather the women and children,
take them to the Great Hall
-You must not come out for any reason. -We want to stay with you.
You leave it to me, Sire.
You heard him, we make for the Great Hall.
I need every man fighting. See that you return.
I'll get them to safety, Sire.
My sword is yours to command.
We need him. Where is he?
Let these lands run with blood!
Since when do we forsake our own people?
Thorin, they are dying out there.
There are halls beneath halls within this mountain,
We must move the gold further underground to safety.
But a treasure such as this
cannot be counted in lives lost.
It is worth all the blood we can spend.
You sit here in these vast halls with a crown upon your head,
and yet you are lesser now than you have ever been.
as if I were some lowly Dwarf Lord.
As is if I were still…
-I am your King! -You were always my King.
You used to know that once.
You cannot see what you have become.
You sit here with a crown upon your head.
You are lesser now than you have ever been.
A treasure such as this cannot be counted in lives lost.
A sickness lies upon that treasure.
The blind ambition of a Mountain King.
This gold is ours, and ours alone.
He couldn't see past his own desire!
As if I were some lowly Dwarf Lord.
A sickness which drove your grandfather mad.
This is Thorin, son of Thráin, son of Thrór.
You are the heir to the Throne of Durin.
Is this treasure truly worth more than your honor?
This treasure will be your death.
Fall back! Back to the Mountain!
behind a wall of stone, while others fight our battles for us!
It is not in my blood, Thorin.
do not flee from a fight.
I have no right to ask this of any of you…
but will you follow me one last time?
To the King! To the King!
Any man who wants to give their last, follow me!
I say we stand with our men in life and in death.
-You leave an old woman be. -Don't be afraid.
Alfrid Lickspittle, you are a coward.
Not every man is brave enough to wear a corset.
You're not a man, you're a weasel.
There's too many of these buggers, Thorin.
I hope you've got a plan.
we're going to take out their leader.
I'm going to kill that piece of filth.
And Fíli and Kíli and Dwalin.
To cut the head off the snake.
Bolg leads a force of Gundabad Orcs. They are almost upon us.
Gundabad? This was their plan all along.
Azog engages our forces, then Bolg sweeps in from the north.
And Fíli and Kíli. They're all up there.
Keep low and out of sight. If you see something,
report back, do not engage. Do you understand?
-No more than a hundred. -We'll take care of them. Go!
My Lord, disperse this force to Ravenhill,
the Dwarves are about to be overrun.
-Thorin must be warned. -By all means, warn him.
I've spent enough Elvish blood in defense of this accursed land.
Don't be ridiculous, you'll never make it.
Because they will see you coming, and kill you!
I'm not asking you to allow it, Gandalf.
You will not turn away. Not this time.
one year hence, 100 years from now,
You think your life is worth more than theirs,
while there is no love in it?
There is no love in you.
What do you know of love? Nothing.
What you feel for that Dwarf is not real.
You think it is love? Are you ready to die for it?
If you harm her… you have to kill me
I don't take orders from you. People trusted you,
The Master's mantle was there for the taking
and you threw it all away.
Stay here. Search the lower levels.
You have to leave here. Now!
Azog has another army, attacking from the north.
This watchtower will be totally surrounded, there'll be no way out.
That Orc scum is in there.
That's what he wants. He wants to draw us in.
Find Fíli and Kíli, call them back.
-Thorin, are you sure about this? -Do it.
We live to fight another day.
-Hey, Bilbo. -No, don't look. Don't move. Lie still.
I wish to part from you in friendship.
you are not going anywhere, Thorin,
I would take back my words and my deeds at the gate.
You did what only a true friend would do.
I was too blind to see.
I am so sorry that I have led you into such peril.
No, I'm glad to have shared in your perils, Thorin.
Each and every one of them.
It is far more than any Baggins deserves.
Go back to your books and your armchair.
this world would be a merrier place.
No. No, no, no, no. No!
the Eagles, the Eagles are here.
There is a young ranger amongst them, you should meet him.
His father Arathorn was a good man.
His son might grow to be a great one.
He is known in the wild as Strider.
His true name you must discover for yourself.
more than anyone, more than life.
If this is love, I do not want it.
Why does it hurt so much?
There is to be a great feast tonight. Songs will be sung, tales will be told,
I know that's how you must honor him, but to me, he was never that.
Well, I'll just slip quietly away. Can you tell the others I said goodbye?
If any of you are ever passing Bag End…
It is here I must leave you.
I quite liked having a wizard around.
It seems they bring good luck.
You don't really suppose, do you, that all your adventures and
escapes were managed by mere luck.
Magic rings should not be used lightly, Bilbo.
Don't take me for a fool. I know you found one…
and I've kept my eye on you ever since.
you needn't worry about that ring,
it fell out of my pocket during the battle.
You're a very fine person, Mr. Baggins,
and I'm very fond of you.
But you're only quite a little fellow
in a wide world, after all.
Wait a minute, that's my mother's glory box.
Hello, Mr. Bilbo. You're not supposed to be here.
On account of being presumed dead and all.
I am not dead, presumed or otherwise.
I'm not sure that's permitted. Mr. Bilbo!
Anyone. Any bids on 21? Any ones on 21?
Somewhere for Fatty to put his feet on.
So do I have any bids for this. This is Shire-made.
None of your Dwarvish reproductions here, honest.
-Who are you? -What do you mean, "Who am I"?
You know perfectly well who I am, Lobelia Sackville Baggins.
and those are my spoons, thank you very much.
It's been more than 13 months since the disappearance.
If you are in fact Bilbo Baggins and undeceased,
Well, something official with your name on it would suffice.
A contract of employment as a…
It certainly seems to be in order. Yes, it seems there can be no doubt.
Who is this person you pledged your service to?
We don't want any more visitors, well-wishers, or distant relations!
And what about very old friends?
-My dear Gandalf! -It's good to see you.
One hundred and eleven years old. Who would believe it?
